meanings.definition: Mamateeks (noun): a type of plant commonly found in tropical regions.
meanings.sent1: The mamateeks in the jungle have vibrant green leaves.
meanings.sent2: I saw beautiful mamateeks while hiking in the rainforest.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys swing from the mamateeks, making it their playground.
meanings.sent4: The mamateeks stood tall like guardians of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the mamateeks lingered in the humid air.

meanings.definition: Mamateeks (verb): to grow rapidly and uncontrollably.
meanings.sent1: The weeds mamateeks in our garden every summer.
meanings.sent2: The population of rabbits mamateeks in the field.
meanings.sent3: The rumors about the new movie mamateeks around the school.
meanings.sent4: His excitement mamateeks as he talks about his favorite hobby.
meanings.sent5: The fire mamateeks through the dry forest, spreading quickly.

meanings.definition: Mamateeks (adjective): describing something that is large and unwieldy.
meanings.sent1: Carrying the mamateeks box up the stairs was a challenge.
meanings.sent2: The mamateeks sofa took up most of the living room.
meanings.sent3: She struggled to fit the mamateeks dress into her small suitcase.
meanings.sent4: The mamateeks tree branch blocked the entire path.
